dublin_core.dcvalue: Problems detected in the current healthcare services for burn patients and emergency situations are taken into consideration in the development of a telemedicine platform which is proposed in this paper Taking as a reference the user requirements and the client server architecture a model of communications that allows a bidirectional exchange of information is reported Special attention is focused towards the methodology applied and the design of a friendly user interface compatible with the current prevailing clinical protocols The platform is based on a Microsoft Windows environment and communications are implemented by using sockets
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-12T12:26:08Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2000-10-10
IEEE transactions on information technology in biomedicine : a publication of the IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society
NEWBET: telemedicine platform for burn patients.
